name: Four Points Meriden

reviews.text: Kudos to the staff. Everyone is pleasant and made me feel welcome.
reviews.title: Decent enough

reviews.text: The property is not quite up to SPG standards, but certainly better than some other brands properties that occupy a similar niche.
reviews.title: A Time Capsule

reviews.text: Oh, the breakfast buffet is yummy.
reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect

reviews.text: Wow! Talk about a step back in time!
reviews.title: Nice Stay
what you would expect
reviews.text: This place has Zenith television sets - the kind that weigh 200lbs for a 30" screen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Points in Meriden while in town to celebrate our anniversary with family. The hotel staff greeted us promptly and checked us in pretty quickly. The path from the front desk to the elevator is a little quirky, but we were pleased when we saw the interior of the room. We had a king-sized bed with a desk and the room was pretty spacious. Our bed was quite comfortable and the bath room was adequate, if a little dated.
reviews.title: Solid Choice in Central CT

reviews.text: The location on Research Parkway is somewhat off the beaten path, but our GPS got us to the property without any problem. We were there for only one night and didn't patronize the restaurant / bar. Overall, we were quite satisfied with the hotel and would stay again if we need accomodations in the area.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.text: The Meriden Four Points is a little grubby but the staff were extreemly pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice place and very clean!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice quiet location but the hotel is beginning to show its age a bit... spots on the rugs... stains on the windows... etc. The folks were quite pleasant and helpful. The bar was a little depressing. It is a big bar and it had a half dozen customers who looked like they were trying their best to ignore the live entertainment. A singer who wasn't bad trying his best to entertain a bunch of customers that were ignoring him.... depressing.
reviews.title: Don't expect service if you book on Hotwire or Priceline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hey its an inexpensive commercial hotel... I've stayed in worse.
reviews.title: Good place for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Rooms were ok - supposedly they're upgrading most of the hotel, so perhaps it'll get better in the future.
reviews.title: A decent place to stay if you're passing through

reviews.text: Our stay began by entering a moist, warm room. While the A/C kind of worked, it didn't put out enough juice to make the room very comfortable. But since we were using Starpoints to get the room on discount, it wasn't enough to make a stink about things.
reviews.title: Great event place

reviews.text: The gym was small, but sufficient. The lobby was uninspiring. But overall, it wasn't a bad stay as we passed through the area. I'm always partial to Starwood hotels - and while this wasn't their best hotel, it sure beats all their competitors.
reviews.title: Do not book on Hotwire if you want good service or a good room. This hotel is not 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay if you are having an event. The room was all little outdated, but beds were comfortable, bathroom was nice and floors were clean. Not really suited for extended stays. Fridge and microwave are extra. No free breakfast and restaurant is somewhat pricey. Ok place, but focus is definitely on the venues
reviews.title: Very Nice Place

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel many times since 2006. It has steadily gone down hill. Back in December 2011 when looking for accommodations we called the hotel for a rate, it was a bit high, so we decided to look on Hotwire (we had used them before & was extremely satisfied with the results). We never book less than a 3 star hotel when booking. We were pleasantly surprised when the Four Points came up when we booked blindly. Wrong. The pool was not heated, the hotel needs staff that are trained properly. The rooms are outdated and worn. We had no soap in our bathroom & the sheets did not fit the bed.The dinner experience was terrible. We did not find satisfaction when we brought our problems to the attention of the Manager,
reviews.title: Good Value!

reviews.text: The Four Points Sheraton is hidden from the main road, but has easy access to the highway which is a plus for travelers. Despite its dated "feel" it is clean and the employees are friendly and helpful. The pool area is nothing to write home about, but it serves the purpose when traveling with young children. Hotel patrons are greeted courteously and requests are answered promptly. It is a twenty minute drive from downtown New Haven, but I would still recommend it for anyone looking for a quiet and clean resting point.
reviews.title: Dated but clean and friendly

reviews.text: This is an old dated property in need of serious update..
reviews.title: Not 3 Star

reviews.text: My room #503 had huge water stains over the windows.. disgusting..
reviews.title: A bit run down but overall ok and good value for money

reviews.text: Nothing special here.
reviews.title: Four Points by Sheraton needs serious upgrades!

reviews.text: As many other reviewers have pointed out the hotel is quite dated with an 80s feel, there was a hint of stale smoke in the room I stayed in and the clientele in the hotel and adjacent bar is perhaps not the most glamorous but overall the positives outweigh the negatives. The bed is comfortable with a big bed, it's got decent facilities with a coffeemaker in the room, free wi-fi, there is a gym and swimming pool and the restaurant downstairs offered a great breakfast buffet. The only thing I missed was a safe in the room. Staff was also very friendly and helpful and the hotel is conveniently located a short drive away from the highway.
reviews.title: good value

description: The Four Points by Sheraton Meriden is centrally located at the crossroads of Connecticut; we’re in the middle of one of the fastest growing industrial parks in the state, Research Park. Quinnipiac University, Yale University, Wesleyan University, Gouveia Vineyards, and the Chevrolet (Oakdale) Theater are all a short drive away.Meriden Connecticut is a great place to visit in the fall with Historic Hubbard Park and scenic fall foliage views at Mirror Lake both located close by. Lake Compounce Theme Park is a short drive away offering plenty of family friendly activities including the Haunted Graveyard at Lake Compounce through the month of October. The crisp autumn air makes golfing a perfect pastime this time of year. Check out the nearby TPC River Highlands in Cromwell, Connecticut. It’s apple picking season! So indulge in those scrumptious fruits at Blue Hills Orchard, Inc. where you can pick located less than 10 miles from our doors!Talk about cozy. Come and relax in our comfortable guest rooms featuring the Four Points by Sheraton Four Comfort Beds, 27” televisions featuring cable, free wireless internet, individual climate control, radio/alarm clock, coffee maker and room service! In addition all guests can enjoy, our Business Center, Free parking, our luxurious, heated indoor pool, exercise room/facilities and our 100% smoke-free environment.Planning a meeting or event? We offer 18 different meeting space venues as well as audio/visual equipment and Technicians!Hang out in our newly-opened Silver City Sports Bar and Grille. Catch the game on one of 14 large or plasma screen TVs. Personal table speakers will make sure you don’t miss a minute of the action. Gather your friends and family and join in the fun while enjoying a tasty treat from the family-friendly menu.
